replies.body: I would just get a new one. You could try tape but don't try pulling it apart otherwise that could destroy it altogether.

replies.body:
Just get a good new headset that is durable. By your replies I doubt that you will fix it.

I would recommend Logitech G430. Very durable (dropped them from 2 meters, threw them, kicked them and still works). Good quality mic and speakers. Amazing surround sound and settings. Overall really nice headset. Also a braided cable so less of a chance of it getting torn.

Though its quite pricy and you might want to go with a cheaper alternative. Theres a lot of headsets that are very similar in quality and cheaper.
